metadata.title: Real-time Operating Systems Education Kit
subject: arm
rtos
stm32f4-discovery
real-time-operating-system
keil-mdk
metadata.description: Design and program real-time operating systems on Arm-based platforms and use them to improve their application performance

metadata.title: Introduction to Real-time Operating Systems, Module 1
subject: arm
rtos
stm32f4-discovery
real-time-operating-system
keil-mdk
metadata.description: An introduction to Operating Systems and Real-time Operating Systems.

metadata.title: Getting Started with Keil MDK, Module 1, Getting Started
subject: arm
rtos
stm32f4-discovery
real-time-operating-system
keil-mdk
metadata.description: Getting started with Keil MDK. KEIL µVision5 is a widely-used IDE particularly in the embedded software region. It has full support for the STM32F4 Discovery Board and is really easy-to-use

metadata.title: Operating Systems Overview, Module 2
subject: arm
rtos
stm32f4-discovery
real-time-operating-system
keil-mdk
metadata.description: Look at the different OS components, including: Process management, memory management, file system management, I/O management, networking, security and graphical user interface management.

metadata.title: Process, Tasks and Threads, Module 3
subject: arm
rtos
stm32f4-discovery
real-time-operating-system
keil-mdk
metadata.description: Covers the following topics: What a process is, basic view of memory layout, how switching between processes is achieved, some examples from Linux and RTX, how to terminate a process, the concepts of context switching and various states of process.

metadata.title: Processing Text in Assembly Language, Module 3, Lab 1
subject: arm
rtos
stm32f4-discovery
real-time-operating-system
keil-mdk
metadata.description: In this exercise you will execute assembly code on your board using the debugger in order to examine its execution at the processor level. This lab aims to get you familiar with the development environment and understand how the hardware “plumbing” is hard.

metadata.title: RTX Basics, Module 3, Lab 2
subject: arm
rtos
stm32f4-discovery
real-time-operating-system
keil-mdk
metadata.description: In this lab you will configure the RTX and create and destroy some tasks using the RTX RTOS. You are expected to walk through how the OS performs task creation, termination and switching operations.

metadata.title: Scheduling, Module 4
subject: arm
rtos
stm32f4-discovery
real-time-operating-system
keil-mdk
metadata.description: In this module, we will cover the various levels of scheduling of tasks, scheduling algorithms which can be non-pre-emptive or pre-emptive. We will also describe Quantum size of task, priority of task and how to evaluate performance. Next, we will concentrate on Real Time Scheduling and aperiodic Real time scheduling.

metadata.title: Concurrency, Module 5
subject: arm
rtos
stm32f4-discovery
real-time-operating-system
keil-mdk
metadata.description: In this module we will learn about concurrency scheduling, multiprocessing environment, read-write by multiple CPU, mutual exclusion by hardware and software mutex, Example: Dekker’s algorithm, use of semaphore, message passing and mail box communication, and about deadlock.

metadata.title: Implementing Mutex, Module 5, Lab 3
subject: arm
rtos
stm32f4-discovery
real-time-operating-system
keil-mdk
metadata.description: In this exercise, a simulated environment based on the RTX RTOS is created. From here you will explore some of the concepts and algorithms introduced during the lectures.

metadata.title: Memory, Module 6
subject: arm
rtos
stm32f4-discovery
real-time-operating-system
keil-mdk
metadata.description: In this module we will learn about the details of the memory hierarchy, cache memory,  paging, segmentation etc.

metadata.title: Virtual Memory, Module 7
subject: arm
rtos
stm32f4-discovery
real-time-operating-system
keil-mdk
metadata.description: In this module, we learn about virtual memory, paging, and replacing.

metadata.title: File System and IO, Module 8
subject: arm
rtos
stm32f4-discovery
real-time-operating-system
keil-mdk
metadata.description: In this module, we will learn about: file systems and IO

metadata.title: RTOS and RTX, Module 9
subject: arm
rtos
stm32f4-discovery
real-time-operating-system
keil-mdk
metadata.description: In this module, we will learn about: Why do we need an RTOS, RTX, and CMSIS.

metadata.title: RTX Task and Simple Time Management, Module 10
subject: arm
rtos
stm32f4-discovery
real-time-operating-system
keil-mdk
metadata.description: In this module we will look at RTX Scheduling and Advanced Scheduling algorithms like EDF, RM.

metadata.title: Evaluating Schedular Responsiveness, Module 10, Lab 4
subject: arm
rtos
stm32f4-discovery
real-time-operating-system
keil-mdk
metadata.description: In this lab you will evaluate how changing the scheduling approach (prioritisation and pre-emption) affects how quickly a multithreaded program responds to an input event.

metadata.title: Sharing Data on RTX, Module 11
subject: arm
rtos
stm32f4-discovery
real-time-operating-system
keil-mdk
metadata.description: In this module, we look further into the capabilities of RTX, with a focus on data sharing.

metadata.title: Producer and Consumer, Module 11, Lab 5
subject: arm
rtos
stm32f4-discovery
real-time-operating-system
keil-mdk
metadata.description: In this exercise, you will focus on the producer-consumer problem. You may want to use some primitives of the RTX in order to solve the problem. There may be many possible solutions and you are expected to evaluate their advantages and disadvantages.

metadata.title: Performance Evaluation and OS Aware Debugging, Module 12
subject: arm
rtos
stm32f4-discovery
real-time-operating-system
keil-mdk
metadata.description: In this module we learn about performance evaluation and debugging a program created to run on the microcontroller with an operating system.

metadata.title: OS Debugging, Module 12, Lab 6
subject: arm
rtos
stm32f4-discovery
real-time-operating-system
keil-mdk
metadata.description: Tuning a program to a good, if not optimal, state is a time-consuming task. In this lab, you are expected to improve the performance of the provided project. You will first be introduced to how to evaluate the performance of the provided project with various debugging tools and techniques. By doing so, you will notice performance or, in some cases, even functional bugs.

metadata.title: Appending, Module 13
subject: arm
rtos
stm32f4-discovery
real-time-operating-system
keil-mdk
metadata.description: Look at alternate connectivity options relevant to IoT, focusing on wireless local area networking and low-power wide area networking technologies.
